subject: Personal Finance
title: Loss Aversion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Loss Aversion.

hook.text: Losing $100 hurts about twice as much as finding $100 feels good.

buildup.text: Daniel Kahneman discovered that humans hate losses far more than they enjoy equal gains.

discovery.text: This asymmetry evolved to keep ancestors alive. Losing food mattered more than finding extra.

twist.text: It makes us hold losing stocks too long, hoping to break even instead of cutting losses.

climax.text: Insurance companies profit from this. We overpay to avoid even small potential losses.

quiz.question: According to Kahneman, how do losses compare to equivalent gains?
options: Losses feel about twice as painful
